column4: Is there a way I can have empathy remember my account name but not my password?
wouldn't you simply clear your password from your account?
Are you using Ubuntu 10.10 ?
On th top right, click on the little envelope icon.  Then click contacts, so your contacts window appears.
then click Edit in the menu bar, and select Accounts.
Are you using evolution or empathy?
my icon may be different from yours.  In any case, there is a little icon next to the password.  That is supposed to clear the password.
You should simply be able to click the "Close" button, and your changes are saved.  Is the close button not active?
I also have an "Apply" button.  This is active if I clear my password.
as soon as I clear my password, the "Cancel" and "Apply" buttons become active in my "Messaging and VoIP Accounts" dialo.
diaog = dialog
when you chose continue, what happens?
try ignore.
ha ha, I tried it, and I just got completely disconnected !  For some reason, it did not give me the option to cancel or ignore.
One more thing you can try is... System | Preferences | Passwords and Encryption Keys
(yes, it looks like it had worked for me; I had to re-enter my password on the Administration screen, however, to reconnect.  Empathy did not prompt me for a password).
I register to googletalk.
did you try System | Preferences | Passwords and Encryption Key
there is a "Passwords" tab.  In my setup, I see my google account listed.  I wonder if you can simply delete your jabber entry?
I would guess that removes your password.  May be you need to restart your Empathy to pick-up that change?
I noticed one more thing.  I was able to double-click on my google talk password, and I got a dialog that lets me change or erase the password.
Great! What was the fix?
